013package org.apache.juneau.rest.widget;
014
015import org.apache.juneau.*;
016import org.apache.juneau.rest.*;
017
018/**
019 * Widget that places a powered-by-Apache message on the page.
020 *
021 * <p>
022 * The variable it resolves is <js>"$W{PoweredByApache}"</js>.
023 *
024 * <p>
025 * It produces a simple Apache icon floating on the right.
026 * Typically it's used in the footer of the page, as shown below in the <c>RootResources</c> from the examples:
027 *
028 * <p class='bjava'>
029 *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(
030 *       path=<js>"/"</js>,
031 *       title=<js>"Root resources"</js>,
032 *       description=<js>"Example of a router resource page."</js>
033 *    )
034 *  <ja>@HtmlDocConfig</ja>(
035 *       widgets={
036 *          PoweredByApache.<jk>class</jk>
037 *       },
038 *       footer=<js>"$W{PoweredByApache}"</js>
039 *    )
040 * </p>
041 *
042 * <p>
043 * It renders the following image:
044 * <img class='bordered' src='doc-files/PoweredByApacheWidget.png'>
045 *
046 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
047 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../index.html#jrs.HtmlPredefinedWidgets">Predefined Widgets</a>
048 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../index.html#jrs.HtmlWidgets">Widgets</a>
049 * </ul>
050 */
051public class PoweredByApache extends Widget {
052
053   /**
054    * Returns an Apache image tag hyperlinked to <js>"http://apache.org"</js>
055    */
056   @Override /* Widget */
057   public String getHtml(RestRequest req, RestResponse res) {
058      UriResolver r = req.getUriResolver();
059      return "<a href='http://apache.org'><img style='float:right;padding-right:20px;height:32px' src='"+r.resolve("servlet:/htdocs/asf.png")+"'>";
060   }
061}
062
063
